title: What reasons do we have to dislike K-pop? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a few reasons but this totally varies from person to person. Many people dislike kpop because it’s Korean. Their reasons are something like “You don’t even understand what they are saying”, “What’s the point if you don’t the language etc. But music is a universal language. Even if you don’t understand what they are saying, you can feel the emotions.  Then we have plastic surgery. Many people criticize kpop idols for having plastic surgery. Well, it’s true some idols do. But does it really affect the music they are producing? The answer is no. The kpop industry has high expectations for looks so some idols may feel like they need to fit within the beauty standards. SO, it’s completely their choice. People also don’t like how guys wear makeup. It’s part of their culture. It’s perfectly normal in Korea for any guy to wear makeup, not only idols. Also, I want to point out that literally all actors or singers wear some kind of makeup, whether it's just a little bit of powder to hide the shine on their face or a full face of makeup. They look feminine/gay. Maybe by western standards they do. But in Korean, they are actually considered very masculine. There are many more but I think these are the top ones.
